description: Variation of condition 2 (approved plans) of planning permission 2018/3244 granted 03/03/2020 for the demolition of existing single storey office building and erection of a 4 storey building to provide 3 flats (Class C3); with associated terraces and provision of office (Class B1) floorspace at ground floor level. Extent of variation is to enclose the external staircase and lobby in line with building regulations.
decision_conditions: <p>Full details, including physical samples, of the&nbsp;glazed and aluminium curtain walling system  to be used on the rear fire escape staircase, including 1:20 plan drawings&nbsp;showing how the glass and aluminium fit together, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, in writing, before the commencement of the works hereby approved.&nbsp;</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and appearance of the Conservation Area.</p>

<p>Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans and documents hereby approved detailed drawings/full particulars of the proposed development showing the matters set out below must be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, in writing, prior to occupation. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved, which shall be completed in full prior to the first occupation of the building.	a) A biodiverse, substrate-based extensive living roof (with a minimum substrate depth of 80mm, not including the proposed vegetative mat), including a detailed maintenance plan.</p><p>			REASON: To enhance the character and ecology of the development, to provide undisturbed refuges for wildlife, to promote sustainable urban drainage, to enhance the performance and efficiency of the proposed building and assist in the meeting the Local Development Framework Core Strategy objective of reducing carbon emissions.</p>

<p>Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans and documents hereby approved, the following details to consist of drawings scaled 1:10 (including pictures of precedents) and material samples for all external surfaces, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of above ground works. This shall include but not be limited to:			a) Windows, doors and reveals; b) Balustrades and gates;c) Cycle and bin stores.d) Internalised pipework				The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the conservation area and to provide biodiversity benefits.</p>

<p>All non-Combined Heat and Power (CHP) space and hot water fossil fuel (or equivalent hydrocarbon based fuel) boilers installed as part of the development hereby approved shall achieve dry NOx emission levels equivalent to or less than 40 mg/kWh.	</p><p>				REASON: To protect air quality and people's health by ensuring that the production of air pollutants, such as nitrogen dioxide and particulate matter, are kept to a minimum as a result of the development and to contribute towards the maintenance or to prevent further exceedances of National Air Quality Objectives.</p>

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning insert date of original planning permission (03/03/2020).


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 as amended.

<p>Tree protection shall be erected and the construction carried out in accordance with the findings and recommendations of the Arboricultural Impact Assessment by Arbol EuroConsulting hereby approved and the requirements of the British Standard 5837:2012 - Trees in Relation to Design, Demolition and Construction. All tree protection measures shall be maintained in full throughout all works associated with implementation of the planning permission hereby approved.	</p><p>			REASON: To provide adequate tree protection and reasonable environmental standards in the interests of the appearance of the site and area.</p>

<p>No soil stacks, soil vent pipes, flues, ductwork or any other pipework shall be fixed to the elevations of the building other than as shown on the drawings hereby approved, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.					</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the area.</p>

<p>Prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved a minimum of 4 Swift and/or bat nesting bricks shall be provided at or close to eaves level of the development hereby approved. The bricks/boxes shall be retained thereafter in perpetuity.</p><p>	</p><p>			REASON: in the interests of biodiversity.</p>

<p>The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.				</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.<br></p>
